data.title: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
data.body:
I am getting this error for last week or so. I am waiting in hertzers servers and after a while it crashes. (with also a lot of disconnects).

`Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowKeyNotFoundException()
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.LobbyLogic.UpdateCurrentMap()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Game.SyncLobbyInfo()
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey35.<>m__6A()

   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
`

data.title: Fixes #4615: OpenRA.Utility should expand wildcards in paths
data.body:
Please test it and let me know. I only tested it on bash, using quotes and without quotes.

See also #4426.

data.title: Make map edges straight lines instead of wavey
data.body: I think it would looke better if the map edges were just straight lines instead of having the shroud-reveal artwork which conceals some things.

data.title: Possible AttackGarrisoned typo.
data.body: [AttackGarrisoned](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Attack/AttackGarrisoned.cs#L77) says `FireYaw` but it should probably read `PortYaws`.

data.title: Reduce the number of open pull requests
data.body:
This is a meta-issue.

There are too many pull requests open. Not only it discourages contributors and potential contributors, with every new PR new conflicts and messy rebasings are in order.

How about a weekend where only old but otherwise ready PRs are reviewed, twice a month or something similar?

data.title: Added checks for NumberFormatInfo.InvariantInfo everywhere
data.body: to resolve problems like #5240.

data.title: Codepage error
data.body:
Hi,

when trying to automatically download the original RA files the following error message occured:

Error: codepage 737 not supported

I am running a Mint linux system set to Greek local settings. I faced the same problem when I tried to install the game on the greek version of XP Pro SP3.

I solved the issue (after getting help from the IRC channel) by manually downloading and installing the files.

data.title: closes #4779 Deploy hotkey F not repairing orcas/apaches in cnc/td
data.body: As per  #4779, the HeliReturn activity was lacking any call to the Repair activity. Using ResupplyAircraft instead allows for rearm, and repair if applicable.

data.title: Fixing Helis taking off after rearmed but before repaired
data.body: Fixing an issue that I just created, in that Helis would land, and take off as soon as either they were reloaded, or repaired. Now, if it finds that it's on a building that does both(Specifically Cnc/Td), it will wait until both are finished.

data.title: fixing some trees
data.body: A couple of trees have a footprint that is too big. It looks like you should be able to drive by them, but you can't. They have been set overly-large.

data.title: Changed paradrop shadow
data.body:
A first attempt at addressing #3335

Have you guys discussed this issue further? How do you feel about the idea of extracting the shadow bits from a sprite into a separate sprite and deleting them from the original sprite? Thus rendering units from two sprites?

Or adding a way to render sprites without shadows and only shadows without the other content?

I've tried to figure out a way to do it using palette manipulation, as suggested by @chrisforbes in #3335, but reading the sprite rendering code proved to be too difficult for me. Maybe if you guys could tell me where and how exactly the magic happens with palette application to the rendered image?

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5747153/2874690/5035a4b6-d3f7-11e3-9d17-ae16046e82c5.png)

data.title: Fixed removal of winforms for x86
data.body: Fixes #5255

data.title: OpenRA.CrashDialog.exe not working under Win7x64...
data.body: ...and probably other Windows platforms, as result the game can't even be started.

data.title: buff HeliGun vs. light armor 50% -> 75%
data.body:
Apache, for all its greatness, doesn't do very well at one of the things it's supposed to do well, namely take out light vehicles quickly (humvee, artillery, MLRS, etc.). Apache is required for Nod as a reliable way to take out MLRS, but currently it doesn't do enough damage to take it out with its entire payload (which takes 4 seconds to unload, to boot). A single Apache should be able to destroy an MLRS, if it gets the chance.

If anyone thinks the Apache needs nerfing, I would suggest looking in other areas besides its damage vs. light armor. 

Also, does anyone object to removing the AG/AA distinctions for helicopters? They don't seem needed anymore.

data.title: Console
data.body:
Implements commands as suggested in #4131.

This also adds an INotifyChat event thingy

data.title: Added native Gtk+ crash dialogs on Linux
data.body: A followup of #5244 that addresses the annoyances of the WinForms crash dialog on Linux like #3872 and #3849 using https://help.gnome.org/users/zenity/stable/message.html which is a little limited, but available everywhere http://pkgs.org/download/zenity.

data.title: Add scatter move to planes
data.body: Multiple planes often fly on top of each other and get shot down with one missile/flak from splash damage. This could be avoided if scatter move order with x key also applied to planes.

data.title: 3091 Have Helis take off after repair/rearm
data.body:
As per polish request:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3091

Will run the Helicopter Activity TakeOff() whenever a helicopter is fully rearmed or repaired, or constructed.
TakeOff() attempts to find the rally point for the building below it. If it does not exist, it will simply hover over the building. If it can't, it will simply hover over its current position.

data.title: Shroud outside map borders should have a different color
data.body: It is difficult to tell where the map edges are without scouting. I think it would be better if the shroud that is outside the map borders had a different color, such as dark gray instead of black.

data.title: Ported Tao.OpenAL/OpenGL to SDL2/OpenTK
data.body:
- http://www.mono-project.com/Tao is long gone. This eliminates it completely.
- https://github.com/flibitijibibo/SDL2-CS does have enough OpenTK parts already.
- This also replaces the legacy ARB_ extensions with core OpenGL functions.
- Added some hints from the https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/FAQ for more helpful logs.

data.title: Units will pursue cloaked units after they have re-cloaked.
data.body:
When a stealth tank is targeted by a unit (like a vehicle) and then re-cloaks to retreat, the vehicle which has been told to attack it will keep chasing the stealth tank even though it is invisible. It can pursue it for quite far, sometimes across the map, depending on how close it can stay.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1975134-units-will-pursue-cloaked-units-after-they-have-re-cloaked?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: tweaks to balance: artillery min. range & more
data.body:
Artillery was recently buffed, but I think this makes the fact that they can currently fire at close range is not appropriate. I think artillery should be vulnerable to units that are able to get quite close, instead of being able to fire at them and do massive damage.

The reason min. range of 2c896 was picked is that when you set min. range to 3c0, it is not able to fire exactly 3 cells away. Perhaps the behaviour should change so that 3c0 = 3 cells away. 

(For comparison, MLRS has minimum range of 3).

data.title: Cursor should show a visual indication if the order will be queued.
data.body:
We should show a small clock icon offset from the cursor if the player is holding the queue order (shift) hotkey and the order supports queueing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1974378-cursor-should-show-a-visual-indication-if-the-order-will-be-queued?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove X11 dependency from OSX.
data.body:
This removes Windows.Forms from the game and utility, which combine with the custom libSDL2.dylib in #5190 to remove our dependency on X11/XQuartz under OSX.

This fixes the excessive font-caching delay (#4785) and looks much nicer:

![dialogs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/2871519/de7d8d42-d311-11e3-94d2-3e2dbfc87932.png)

Test packages (osxtest-20140504) are sitting on the build server, and I have verified that the OSX/Windows/Ubuntu packages work.

Hosted own game on own computer 3 times, same crash after a while:
Probably because of people joining there and i had previous game "on" (it crashed so it was still on the server list) at same time?

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477

Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223

```

data.title: Made DeathSounds and their InfDeath relation fully customizable
data.body:
Follow-up to #5236, adressing the concern about hardcoded InfDeaths @pchote pointed out.

Updated to incorporate the feedback provided here.

Fixes PlayVoiceLocal to do what it was intended to do, namely adjust position and volume according to position relative to camera.
Converts InfDeath from int to string.

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: Movable actors
data.body:
After seeing Mailaender's latest comment (about the ingame map editor): https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3377#issuecomment-42101971 that made me think : "we should really be able to move all these actors".

That's why I hope that you'll consider adding a toolbar with a few buttons ; and one of them could let the player move actors.

![2cbcb9f4-d2b0-11e3-88ab-9fc0b8d73092](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2870342/68354960-d2bf-11e3-940a-b28b676b32dd.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1969052-ingame-map-editor-movable-actors?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Swedish locale breaks FieldLoader parsing.
data.body:
```
22:14 < yarre> any ideas why openra wont start on my system? 
               http://pastebin.com/86vQNe6f got an nvidia card with official 
               drivers + cg toolkit installed
22:16 <+pchote> are you using a non-english locale?
22:16 < yarre> yes, swedish utf8
22:16 <+pchote> that is probably the underlying cause of the problem
22:16 <+pchote> I'm not sure of any immediate workaround, except to try 
                switching to english
22:18 < yarre> pchote, thanks now it works :)
22:19 < yarre> should be added to the wiki export LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8 export 
               LANG=en_US.UTF-8 export LANGUAGE=en_US.UTF-8
```

We may want to force the locale in the linux launcher scripts.

data.title: Units chase adv. comm. center after damaged by ion cannon
data.body: After an Ion Cannon strike, units will automatically start moving towards the advanced communications center that called down the strike and try to attack the building. This is probably unintentional behaviour.

data.title: More palette un-hardcoding
data.body:
This time muzzle flashes and tesla zaps.

The muzzle flash customization is a bit limited because the palette is defined under WithMuzzleFlash which is no longer on a per-muzzle/weapon base, so all muzzles of a unit must use the same muzzle palette. Neither an issue for any of the mods currently shipping with OpenRA nor for the TS mod, though.
Similar situation with AttackGarrisoned, which defines only one muzzle palette.
